```{r}
#| message: false
#| warning: false
library(tidyverse)
library(primer.data)
```


```{r}
x <- ces |>
filter(year == 2020) |>
select(approval, education, ideology) |>
drop_na() |> 
slice_sample(n = 2000)
```


```{r}
x |>
ggplot(aes(x = ideology, fill = approval)) + geom_bar() +
labs(title = "Approval ratings of President Trump in 2020", 
subtitle = "Liberals disapproved and Converservatives approved",
x = "Ideology", y = "Number of persons")
```

Political ideology of a citizen will consistently reflect their approval rating of the president. Using a data source from CES, we can unpack this phenomenon and understand why it is.
